div.div: O Grupamento TÃ¡tico MÃ³vel (GTM) foi recriado em 2015 para reforÃ§ar as aÃ§Ãµes de patrulhamento motorizado realizadas pela Guarda Municipal na cidade. Contando com efetivo de mais de 300 guardas, que utilizam boina e colete azuis, o grupamento tambÃ©m atua em situaÃ§Ãµes urgentes e de rÃ¡pida resposta. Com a implantaÃ§Ã£o do GTM, a Guarda Municipal passou a contar com duas forÃ§as para pronto-emprego em operaÃ§Ãµes especiais e apoio a todas as demais unidades operacionais.

AtuaÃ§Ã£o e estrutura â Tendo como principais estratÃ©gias de atuaÃ§Ã£o a rapidez e a mobilidade no patrulhamento, os guardas do GTM atuam diariamente em diversas regiÃµes da cidade, simultaneamente, no combate a desordens urbanas e no ordenamento de trÃ¢nsito. Da base de apoio, localizada em SÃ£o CristÃ³vÃ£o, as equipes motorizadas realizam rondas com o foco no patrulhamento preventivo e tambÃ©m reforÃ§am operaÃ§Ãµes fixas e especiais nos bairros da cidade.
Entre os postos de atuaÃ§Ã£o da Guarda Municipal, que contam com o patrulhamento estratÃ©gico do GTM, estÃ£o a Central do Brasil, e o bairro de Copacabana, como parte das aÃ§Ãµes do programa Rio + Seguro. As equipes tambÃ©m reforÃ§am o patrulhamento em polos culturais e gastronÃ´micos e espaÃ§o de lazer da cidade, como a PraÃ§a SÃ£o Salvador, Baixo GÃ¡vea, Lapa, Centro de TradiÃ§Ãµes Nordestinas, PraÃ§a XV e Quinta da Boa Vista, alÃ©m de atuarem nos dias de jogos e eventos nos estÃ¡dios da cidade, como o MaracanÃ£ e o Nilton Santos. Nesses locais, as equipes do GTM atuam em barreiras para prevenir irregularidades e desordens e tambÃ©m para promover a seguranÃ§a e o bem-estar dos cidadÃ£os.
Os guardas participam de missÃµes especiais da GM-Rio e integradas a diversos Ã³rgÃ£os da Prefeitura, como no apoio a desapropriaÃ§Ãµes de prÃ©dios pÃºblicos, acolhimento de pessoas em situaÃ§Ã£o de rua, fiscalizaÃ§Ãµes realizadas pela VigilÃ¢ncia SanitÃ¡ria e Coordenadoria de Controle Urbano, entre outros. As aÃ§Ãµes tÃªm como foco a seguranÃ§a das equipes de trabalho e tambÃ©m dos cidadÃ£os.
FormaÃ§Ã£o - Para fazer parte do GTM, os guardas municipais passam por curso de formaÃ§Ã£o com duraÃ§Ã£o de 138 horas/aulas, de carÃ¡ter eliminatÃ³rio, com disciplinas como legislaÃ§Ã£o de trÃ¢nsito, atuaÃ§Ã£o em grandes eventos, defesa pessoal e uso diferenciado da forÃ§a, entre outros. Durante o curso, os guardas tambÃ©m participam de estÃ¡gios supervisionais em regiÃµes de grande movimento da cidade.
Mesmo depois de formados, os guardas do grupamento continuam passando por treinamentos periÃ³dicos, com o objetivo de melhorar as prÃ¡ticas operacionais. O GTM sempre mantÃ©m, pelo menos, Â¼ do efetivo realizando treinamentos diversos. Eles passam por tÃ©cnicas de aÃ§Ãµes de controle de distÃºrbios (ACD), uso de instrumentos de menor potencial ofensivo (IMPOS) e equipamentos de proteÃ§Ã£o individual (EPI) e tambÃ©m noÃ§Ãµes de primeiros socorros. As instruÃ§Ãµes sÃ£o ministradas por guardas habilitados do prÃ³prio grupamento, que sÃ£o multiplicadores, e visam o aperfeiÃ§oamento operacional. AlÃ©m disso, a prÃ¡tica de atividades fÃ­sicas tambÃ©m Ã© constante, sendo feita diariamente com foco no condicionamento fÃ­sico.

GTM-Grupamento TÃ¡tico MÃ³vel
Av. Pedro II, nÂº 111, SÃ£o CristÃ³vÃ£o

div.p:
On 4th December 2009, President of India Smt Pratibha Patil graced CAPSI annual conference held at Vigyan Bhawan. She was requested to be Supreme Commander of Private Security Services like Defence forces. She accepted our request with a smile and promised to take care of our industry. It was a Red Letters Day for the Private Security Industry . She became One & Only PRESIDENT of a Nation in the WORLD to grace annual conference of Private Security organisation. Internationally renowned Security Leaders from many countries came to witness that historically unique event.To commemorate that great event we are celebrating 4th December as Private Security Day.

main.h2: BUREAU BADGE, PATCH AND CAP INSIGNIA REVIEW PROCESS
main.h4: IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT YOU NOT ORDER YOUR BADGES, PATCHES AND/OR CAP INSIGNIAS UNTIL YOU HAVE RECEIVED THE BUREAU'S WRITTEN APPROVAL OF YOUR DESIGN FOR EACH ITEM. Ordering these items before receiving the Bureau's approval could result in you incurring unnecessary costs.

strong.span: Requesting Bureau Review of Badge/Patch/Cap Insignia

br.p: To request the review of your company's badge, patch and/or cap insignia design(s), mail/email the following items to:

Bureau of Security and Investigative Services
Attention: Badge and Patch Review
PO Box 989002
West Sacramento, CA 95798-9002

p.a: BadgeandPatch@dca.ca.gov

ol.li: A written letter requesting the Bureau to review the item or items (specify each item in your letter) for which approval is being requested. The letter must be dated and signed by the owner if your company is licensed as a sole ownership, by a partner associated with the license if licensed as a partnership, or by an officer associated with the license if licensed as a corporation.

A printed color copy or sample of the exact design and actual size of the badge, patch and/or cap insignia for which you are requesting to be reviewed.
Business and Professions Code (BPC) Section 7582.26 specifically prohibits licensees from using a title, wearing an insignia or making any statements that could give the impression that the individual is connected in any way with a federal, state or local governmental agency. The Bureau uses the following to help reduce the likelihood that a badge/patch/cap insignia design could be perceived as being anything other than Private Security.

ul.li: Badge: The badge must bear on its face the name of the licensee or a distinctive word indicating the name of the licensee and a unique employee identification number (BPC Sections 7582.26 and 7582.28). Regarding the size of the badge, and the font type and size for the company name and employee identification number, consideration is given to the readability of the information from a reasonable distance. The Bureau has previously approved badges at least 2 inches by 3 inches in size. NOTE: the employee identification number should be sequential and distinctive to the badge.

Patch: The patch must bear on its face the full name of the company, as printed on the license and the words Private Security (BPC Sections 7582.26 and 7582.27). Regarding the size of the patch, and the font type and size for the company name and Private Security, consideration is given to the readability of the information from a reasonable distance. The Bureau has previously approved patches at least 3 inches by 4 inches in size.

Cap Insignia: The insignia must bear on its face the name of the licensee or a distinctive word indicating the name of the licensee, and the employee identification number by which the person may be identified by the licensee (BPC Section 7582.26 and 7582.28). Regarding the size of the insignia, and the font type and size for the company name, consideration is given to the readability of the information from a reasonable distance. The Bureau has previously approved insignias 2 inches by 2 inches in size.
No seal, emblem, acronym or configuration may be used on a badge, patch, or cap insignia that is similar to one used by a federal, state or local governmental agency (BPC 7582.26).

ol.li: If a badge, patch or cap insignia includes the U.S. flag, no mark, letter, word, number, figure, or drawing of any kind may be superimposed on it (U.S. Flag Code).
No badge, patch, or cap insignia may include the Great Seal of the State of California (California Government Code Section 401).

The Bureau recommends contacting the city, county, or city and county which you intend to conduct business to determine if you must also receive approval from the city, county, or city and county to use your selected uniform and insignia designs (BPC 7583.38).

br.h4: Questions regarding badge/patch/cap insignias may be directed to BadgeandPatch@dca.ca.gov

meta.name: description
meta.content:
1 review of Corporate America Private Security "This firm will match whatever need you desire... Whether it is for:
1. Bodyguard 2. Warehouse/Distribution Centers 3. Events 4. Schools including the whole districts 5. Personal residnces 6. Businesses 7. Fill in the blank.
CAP Security is extremely profession that uses off-duty cops or retired cops and a brevy of professions in the protection industry.
All in all, this is a one stop shop for security. CAP does not only provide able bodies but also technology based security such as cameras, motion lighting, etc.
CAP thrives with loss prevention (theft) including internal affairs where the majority of small business theft occurs. CAP will audit your internal security with professionals that have been doing police work since most Yelpers were born.
Good luck and be safe. Guns don't kill people, criminals do...
Tax Tip: If you itemize deductions, do not forget to include credit card interest."

Corporate America Private Security - South El Monte, CA

Specialties: Corporate America Private Security is one of the fastest growing companies in the security industry today. While providing a wide range of security services, CAPS is committed to meeting and surpassing client expectations while consistently delivering the highest quality performance. We combine the quality of an in-house security operation with the flexibility and value of an external provider. By taking a fresh, innovative approach to this complex business sector, CAPS has achieved a reputation for its quality, responsiveness and value. Through exceptional service and business transparency, our commitment to meeting and exceeding goals is found in the development of our long-term relationships. Combining advanced technology and high standards, CAPS is able to deliver strategic and tactical solutions while effectively raising the bar on security. Established in 2014. CAPS is committed to achieving its business goals by performing with integrity, high ethical standards and in compliance with the guidelines set forth between CAPS and the client. This is essential to building lasting relationships with our clients and business partners.

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Corporate America Private Security","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/aDBmxqXyWQZaWj4oNXMrVQ/l.jpg","telephone":"(626) 448-2277","address":{"streetAddress":"968 Durfee Ave","addressLocality":"South El Monte","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"CA","postalCode":"91733"},"review":[{"author":"Christopher H.","datePublished":"2015-01-09T23:41:28-08:00","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"This firm will match whatever need you desire...
Whether it is for:

1. Bodyguard
2. Warehouse/Distribution Centers
3. Events
4. Schools including the whole districts
5. Personal residnces
6. Businesses
7. Fill in the blank.

CAP Security is extremely profession that uses off-duty cops or retired cops and a brevy of professions in the protection industry. 

All in all, this is a one stop shop for security. CAP does not only provide able bodies but also technology based security such as cameras, motion lighting, etc. 

CAP thrives with loss prevention (theft) including internal affairs where the majority of small business theft occurs. CAP will audit your internal security with professionals that have been doing police work since most Yelpers were born. 

Good luck and be safe. Guns don't kill people, criminals do...

Tax Tip: If you itemize deductions, do not forget to include credit card interest."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":1}}
